Deprecated API

Contents

  • For Removal
  • Classes
  • Exceptions
  • For Removal 
    Element Description
    br.com.armange.commons.thread.CaughtExecutorThreadFactory
    Consider to use ExceptionCatcherThreadFactory A thread-factory that sets some thread parameters if non-null:
    • Name
    • Priority
    • Uncaught exception handler
    br.com.armange.commons.thread.ExecutorResult
    Consider to use ExecutorResult A bean that wrappes a thread result, composed by a ExecutorService, a Future list and another ExecutorResult list for timeouted threads.
    The ExecutorResult list will be present when some thread has a timeout.
    One Future will be present by each thread started.
    Consider seeing the logical relationship between ExecutorService and Future in their respective documentation.
    br.com.armange.commons.thread.ScheduledCaughtExecutorService
    Consider to use ScheduledThreadBuilderExecutor A ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor that can additionally perform actions after thread has completed normally. Consider seeing java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor#afterExecute(Runnable, Throwable)
    br.com.armange.commons.thread.ThreadBuilder
    Consider to use ThreadBuilder Useful structure for thread creation in the following scenarios:
    • Timeout

      The thread will be active only until the timeout be fired.

    • Delay

      The thread will be active only after the time delay be completed.

    • Interval

      The thread will be repeated after the time interval be completed.

    • Exception handling

      Handles of uncaught exceptions can be thrown and handled within threads.

    Note:
    The thread will wait a minimum delay (ThreadBuilder.MINIMAL_REQUIRED_DELAY) if and only if a (ThreadBuilder.setAfterExecuteConsumer(BiConsumer)) or a (ThreadBuilder.setUncaughtExceptionConsumer(Consumer)) is present. 
     Example:

 final ExecutorService thread = ThreadBuilder
          .newBuilder() //New object to build a new thread.
          .setDelay(1000) //The thread will wait one second before start.
          .setTimeout(4000) //The thread will be canceled after four seconds.
          .setInterval(1000) //The thread will be repeated every second.
          .setAfterExecuteConsumer(afterExecuteConsumer) //A consumer will be called after thread execution.
          .setUncaughtExceptionConsumer(throwableConsumer) //A consumer will be called after any exception thrown.
          .setMayInterruptIfRunning(true) //The thread interruption/cancellation will not wait execution.
          .setSilentInterruption(true) //Interruption and Cancellation exceptions will not be thrown.
          .setExecution(anyRunnable) //The thread execution.
          .setThreadNameSupplier(() -> "Thread name")
          .setThreadPrioritySupplier(() -> 4)
          .start();
    br.com.armange.commons.thread.ThreadUtil
    Consider to use ThreadUtil Useful structure for handling the current segment. Some methods that require handling a checked exception are rewritten in this class, however, throwing an unchecked exception.
    br.com.armange.commons.thread.UncheckedException
    Consider to use UncheckedException Unchecked exceptions can be thrown instead of the RuntimeException option to release the handling of exceptions when they do not need to be handled.
